subject: Pedal Registering Movement
description_text:
Hello, I am encountering an issue with my Simsonn Pro x pedals and I cannot
solve it or find a resolution.

When calibrating, the pedals are registering some sort of movement shown in
my attached video.

This takes place when calibrating the simagic wheel and when calibrating
the pedals themselves in iracing.

I am not registering any movement in the simsonn software however and the
pedals have been calibrated.

Any solutions you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Chris

conversations.body_text: Hi Christopher French Jr,    This issue is caused by the RX axis of our previous handbrake not being disabled, which resulted in interference. You can try resolving it using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1:    Open the SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1 software.    Click the “Restore” button in the interface.    Then click the “Save” button.    Reinsert the USB cable.    Finally, test to see if the RX axis has been successfully disabled.    You can also try using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1. In the software interface, click the “Restore” button, then click “Save”. After that, reinsert the USB and test whether the RX axis has been successfully disabled.       https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mS9dS2GyzhRYo81BcmTIOXY1POa6RvST/view?usp=drive_link

Thank you for your response. I do not see a restore button in the
interface. Where would I locate this?

On Sat, Sep 6, 2025 at 11:21 PM support@simsonn.com

Thank you for your respons.

I do not have a handbrake. Only a gas pedal and brake pedal.

There are no restore buttons on my simsonn interface.

On Sat, Sep 6, 2025 at 11:21 PM support@simsonn.com

I did some additional tests.

I unplugged the wheel and all other USB ported items and the laptop charger.

I went to the control panel in my pc. Went to properties for the simsonn
pedals.

I noticed the z axis sits still but the x rotation is twitching whether the
brake or gas pedal is plugged into the simsonn power box.

When I unplug both the brake and gas pedal - the x rotation is still
twitching up and down. I have included a short video of what I am seeing
and showing both pedal are unplugged from the box.

Is the power box the issue?

On Sat, Sep 6, 2025 at 11:34 PM Christopher French Jr <
chris.french1791@gmail.com> wrote:

> Thank you for your respons.
>
> I do not have a handbrake. Only a gas pedal and brake pedal.
>
> There are no restore buttons on my simsonn interface.
>
> On Sat, Sep 6, 2025 at 11:21 PM support@simsonn.com

Thank you for forwarding the screenshot. However, it does not allow me to
click revert when the pedals are unplugged.

Any solution?

On Sun, Sep 7, 2025 at 12:01 AM support@simsonn.com
Hi，Christopher French Jr，  Please connect the power supply first,  then click the “Revert” button followed by the “Save” button.

I have done this prior to reaching out to support and have done it once
more. It did not solve the problem.

I did some additional tests.

I unplugged the wheel and all other USB ported items and the laptop charger
in order to try and isolate.

I went to the control panel in my pc. Went to properties for the simsonn
pedals.

I noticed the z axis does not move but the x rotation is twitching
regardless if only the brake is plugged into the control box or only the
gas pedal.

When I unplug both the brake and gas pedal - the x rotation is still
twitching up and down. I have included a short video of what I am seeing
and showing both pedal are unplugged from the box.

This is also the same issue I am seeing in the sim that causing calibration
interference with both the wheel and pedals.

Is the control box the issue?


On Sun, Sep 7, 2025 at 12:09 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Christopher French Jr,  Please install the Todesk software. No registration is required, and if it prompts you to register, simply close the window. I can assist you remotely to resolve the issue right now.      https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

I have installed.

Device Id ToDesk:
878 627 097
Temporary password:pw722g32

On Sun, Sep 7, 2025 at 12:17 AM support@simsonn.com
